reviewText: I always give Bucket at least 4 stars on everything he does (except maybe the Over the Chicken Coop thing). I was so excited to finally get a Bucket DVD. I craved it from the time I heard it was coming out. I'm a big fan despite some of his quirkier and more disjointed efforts. So... when this DVD fell into my hands I threw it in and started trying to find footage of one of my favorite guitarists in action. Wow! What a disappointment! The two DVDs in this package are so full of crap that its hardly worth putting them in the machine. Sure, there is concert footage that sorta blows you away, but it looks my brother jamming in the garage. The concerts are bootleg quality at best. The rest of the footage on this DVDs is worse. The sound quality is terrible. I also had a major beef with the actual navigation on the DVDs. There are no titles so you just hit things at random and hope it doesn't take you to some retarded little video clip. I do understand this is all an effort on Bucket's part to inspire confusion, insanity, etc, but let's be honest, it sucks. The music and what little good footage and songs there are get 5 stars from me. The rest of this mammoth pile of pathetic-ness, get a 1. Since the bad outweighs the good, I give it 2 stars. I'm always a fan of Buckethead, but this is an insult.
Title: N/A

reviewText: Simply put, I bought this, brought it home, and spent the wee hours of the night smiling on the couch as the one and only Buckethead filled my living room with his unique brand of guitar-shred-funk-fusion-dementia. This dvd is a trip, from the wacked out menus to the oodles of content that cover his whole career so far...videos (Praxis!), discography (you think you have it all, but I assure you, you don't), and a bonus dvd with 2 live shows (it doesn't hurt that I can see myself in the Boston one, laughing like a goon as he hands out toys). There's just tons of bucketgoodies hiding in here. This dude is just the whole package-Eddie Van Halen and Eddie Hazel all in one, mixed with Leatherface and The Shape. So rad. This dvd definitely had a lot of time and creativity put into it, so to anyone who doesn't enjoy this for the perfect representation of the Bucketman that it is, you simply be missin' the point. Might I suggest you stick to your Dream Theater/Satriani/G3 dvd's, you 5.1 Surround sound obsessed prog-metal nerds...you don't like chickens, get out the coop!
summary: What any TRUE Buckethead fan would expect/want...

reviewText: Well, I have only been into Buckethead for a few months after I saw him on Claypool's video. This dvd set is less than expected for me. I wanted to see him in concert with a real drummer and bass player but didnt get that. One review mentioned 2 full concerts on one cd but I never found it. Anyway, it was kind of fun to watch the goofy stuff but sure wanted to see more concert footage. After playing with this dvd for a while, I did find the second concert and didn't like it very much.
summary: Bucket half full or half empty ?
Title: N/A

reviewText: I consider Buckethead a unique artist with an original vision.  The manifestation of that vision on his 13th Anniversary DVD, while intriguing and amusing, is for only his most devoted, hard-core fans.I've liked some of his stuff on YouTube, and saw the DVD by chance passing through a cd/dvd store in a mall and took a chance.  Bad decision.I can go along with the "Cheapo Depot" look and vibe, but when it comes down to delivering content, this is a bloated, nearly unwatchable video.  The content is presented in two disks, but it should have been one.  The live concert material on disk 2 looks as if shot on consumer grade video cameras, featuring Bucket playing along to pre-recorded tracks, doing the robot, and a display of his num-chucks skills.  The music, speed-rock with doses of country chicken pickin and classical flavors, sounds largely the same from song to song.  Frankly, I was bored.The is an experiment gone wrong.  His over-the-top Dr. Phibes meets Yngvie meets the dark side of Disney is realized as an unfocused mess on this package.  The result it had on me is that I am unlikely to buy another DVD or song from him without checking into reviews first, so buyer beware.  Memo to Buckethead: find someone to focus your vision and move on to the next phase of your career.
Title: N/A

reviewText: This is an amazing DVD! Buckethead covers the entire spectrum! He covers everything from science fiction, horror, zombies, classical art, pop art, funk, jazz, rock, alternative, progressive, etc. He is definately the Frank Zappa of the new century. His guitar playing is incredible and his compositions are mind boggling. I thoroughly enjoyed everything I have seen so far (I am only through the first disc). But the navigation was no problem and extremely interesting. I loved the announcers voice! I was immediately smiling and sometimes laughing outloud! I just love his take on things. Just the video for the Wheels of Torment is worth the price of the DVD. An amazing video. How did they take the classical painting of hell and disect it and animate it and throw in images of Buckethead playing guitar - or was it a mandolin? I also loved the Ballad of Buckethead with Les Claypool - He's alive, He's half dead, Folks just call him Buckethead! Great! The Dental Commander was interesting animation and the Bootsy Collins - Funky Express Card was so damned funny I couldn't stop laughing. As well as the with the clips of the japanese monsters invading Tokyo. I also loved hearing his early demos for Guitar Player. Absolutely amazing guitar and composition. I really recommend this DVD to anyone who loves the guitar work of Steve Vai, Joe Satriani, Mike Keneally, Frank Zappa, Adrian Belew, John Petrucci, etc. This guy is in the same league and then some. A very important guitar hero and composer. This DVD is worth ten times the cost. Don't miss it!
Title: N/A

reviewText: With all the polarized reviews floating around, I feel the need to weigh in as a long-time Buckethead fanatic. In a sense, it's as simple as this: If you're a super fan who likes Buckethead even when he's weird and lo-fi playing fast guitar along with cheesy drum machines and Texas Chainsaw Massacre samples, you'll love this DVD. If you're expecting a slick concert DVD in the style of the major pop acts of today, you're out of luck. But then again, isn't that why you like Buckethead in the first place? Because he's so different?This is not a concert DVD. There is concert footage, but like most Buckethead albums, it's not overly produced. It's more like a scrap book filled with lots of junvenalia and camcorder footage of Buckethead and his crew being silly and weird. There are some truly surprising bits such as Buckethead as a guest in John Zorn's Painkiller project (the concert footage is almost unwatchable, but you get the effect) or Buckethead pretending to have an injured hand while waiting for his suit case at baggage claim or a bizarre spot on Japanese TV. Mostly, it's just cool to see Buckethead hanging out instead of shredding.Now, that's not to say there aren't some awesome concert clips. To my knowledge, Buckethead has never had a concert professionally recorded, so don't get your hopes up. Some of the stuff must have come from fans or his crew. Who knows - it's low quality, but you get the effect. Are you really expecting to see amazing video quality of the Deli Creeps in the early 90s? I'm surprised the videos even exist.For all the people complaining that this DVD is crap, seriously - do you want Buckethead to go commercial and put out a regular concert DVD like everyone else, or do you want his unique aesthetic to penetrate every aspect of the DVD experience? The menus may be slightly annoying, but deal with it - he's being creative here. Not everything Buckethead has ever done is top quality anyway. Some of the "grab bag" stuff is obviously just Buckethead messing around on guitar, but it's still fun and it's still cool!Since Buckethead is so reclusive, this DVD is an awesome window into what makes him so special. Buy and enjoy it. If you're not expecting a major studio-quality release, I am sure you'll enjoy this. On the other hand, if you want clear video, great angles, and excellent sound, this is not for you.
Title: N/A

reviewText: If you get this dvd be prepared to see the most beautifully cartoonish and macabre guitar playing this world has ever known, aaaand the marvelous personality that comes with it! To the 3 star reviews I say this; if you want a no-frills guitarist who's afraid to lose his fan base by playing "weird"(oh,who can understand THAT?!) music, go for the characters who will give you that. If you thought this dvd was too "strange" find some of his live stuff that won't make you have so much fun. The video quality isn't 100% because most of it was taken UNPROFESSIONALLY with old-azz cameras by average joes...DUH! If you want video perfection get your 5 angles on the latest Fleetwood Mac dvd. This isn't a movie,it's a toy.here's my review from buckethead.tk when I snagged one of the first pressings:"o.k. here it goes:(anyone who may think i'm a psycho-you're absolutely correct!eh,so i've been spotted already!)day 1:the packagingthe front has a cool buckethead doll on it that resembles a marionette,a drawing of buckethead playing his kfc flying v(there's no kfc letters on eathier bucket hats or the guitar for copyrights,i'm sure) and a yellow robot/amp is plugged into buck's guitar with pink lightning shooting out of it's chest/subwoofer,and the backdrop consists of a drab painting/collage of part of bucke)theadland(from the parking lot?).the top of the dvd says"secret recipie(in an oval)and on a red line across the width of the dvd in bold print id "buckethead".the doll is described as a "do-it-yourself violence doll"and behind the cartoon buckethead is another red strip running the width of the dvd @ maybe a 10-20 degree angle that says"13th anniversary edition".on the bottom of the doll photo it says"20'' remote control action doll(then below it in"deceiving" ;)small print)or dvd-check inside.then below that-"ages 5 and up",although i'm sure that all ages would enjoy it-i'll have to watch to be sure!the dvd's spine has the "ages 5 and up"above the picture of the violence doll,and then in italic red letters is "secret recipie"then in slightly larger letters"buckethead".the background is black.the back of the dvd resembles the back of one of those old-time(80's)g.i.joe or ninja turtle figure packages with the oval-type hole at the top so it can be put on a peg that goes on one of those display boards you see in toy stores(if that makes any sense ;)).in the upper-left is a picture of a computer rendering of the amp/robot from the front cover and a yellow bust(a manequin from the sholders up) of the bald guy with light up eyes that bucket has been known to fool around with.it says in black lettering"herbie",so that kind of explains the robot and all!under that picture is a picture(computer rendering?)of b's flying v guitar with a trippy background picture of a burning cabin/house next to some trees(also seems computer rendered),and the strings of the guitar are "ghost lines"from a picture taken with a slow shudder speed-i think.it says in the same black lettering"guitar"under the picture.then to the right of the pictures are descriptions of the toy inside(i'm too lazy to list them all)such as;"-bleeds real blood","powerful accessories",and"projectile hands fire directly into your eyes or throat"(hope momma don't make me bring it back! >:()! :)and to my dismay it also states in slightly smaller text under the description"doll does not fly"-hey what gives?!as the melvins say;"when you buy something from a person,expect the goddamn thing to work!" ;)next,to the right of the description is a drawing of buckethead with his yellow rainjacket,black pants,and black converse hi-tops on.in his left hand he holds a rooster that he eathier just yanked out of his belly,or b's trying to make him drink a spurt of blood shooting from his gut :(in his right hand he holds a guillotine(i think)with 14 blades on it which he has just used to dice off eathier albert or choptop's head with(i think it's supposed to be one of those two)-and the body is wearing blue overalls.just above the rooster is a blue zomie :(head in a glass case that's half filled with water/preservatives with bug-eyes and a toothy,gaunt,gaping mouth that's open.below the chicken is the herbie hand puppet in orange with white hair,and he's shooting towards b's knee.the bacjground for this picture is a dark turqouis.then below the pictures and descriptions are two red,rectangular text boxes.the first one talks about what to expect on the dvd,and at the bottom in italics says"presented in grab-bag format.headcheese not included"-darn-it-all-annaways,i still gotta find me own 'cheese!the second text box has this in italics at the top"special action features&accessories;",and then talks about "wedge1 and wedge2"-the names of the two discs:#1 consists of the videos,discography,scrapbook,and most the content,presumably.the second wedge is the live boston bootleg show.then there is one of those cardboard cut -out files like the g.i.joe and ninja turtle packaging used to have that explains his story a little and rates his powers-which are most impressive,indeed! :(then to the right of the "file" are the dvd video,ntsc,and all regions logos with the barcode.also,there is another thing as seen on the g.i.joe and ninja turtle packaging of days long passed-a point stamp!with each purchase of secret recipie you'll recieve 6 binge points(good towards who-knows-what?!),and there is a severed hand on the point stamp.the background of the rear side of the dvd is a continuation of bucketheadland.i gotta eat something-it's almost noon now!the inside packaging has no booklet clips on the left side,there instead are dvd pockets on both sides with very nice'n'easy push releases on em!wedge 1 has bucket's head in the middle of the disc with the hole covering his face,and three kfc logos circling the dvd.oh,actually the dvd is the topper of a kfc bucket!wedge 1 is a brand new topper,wedge 2 is an old,worn one and you can see bucket's face in the middle.the booklet included(violence doll instruction manuel) is loose in the case and has a picture of the doll playing guitar on the front,and various instructions on how to use the toy and lists the included accessories.i think it says a warning in spanish not to remove b's mask,and it also says to report to bucketheadland security if any parts are missing cause there is a "rouge tinker"that uses parts for salvage! :othe packaging is awesome,it's all i hoped for:trippiness in that he would utilize packaging inspired by the old 80's toys of yore,give a few giggles and a few scares,have cool artwork,tell about the contents without just blatantly telling what's what(making you wonder if what's written is a joke or not-some folks i show this too surely will be asking me where they can get this doll! ;)),and just putting together a package that even if someone just stumbled upon it in a random store they would be intruiged and facinated to see what this guy's all about!packaging:A+day 2:menus + 1989(warning!!!!!!* ;D ;D ;D*)you know!))sorry for goin' all "american psycho"with the packaging! ;)(actually i'm to the part now where mr bateman is explaining his morning daily regimin,so that may have played a part :()the amazing short film that begins this holy grail is something my grandchildren will remember,surely! ???then i went to the bottom of the middle column once it begins the main menu and clicked-wow! right to the "wonder years"section of secret recipie!had to start at the begginning so i time warped back to the year 1989,(yep,these characters have been at it since the "beneath the remains" days! :onot to mention just a year before that cfh thang started! :'()and instead of going the usual "play all"route i went just clicked anything and that's when things went hazy. >:(i remember a conversation in a citchen(not khicken!)with 2 persons that were discussing something on wall street i think.next,somebodie's hackin' off their hand,and when i came to the deli creeps were sporting great songs and awesome solos! :'(just like the cameraphone commercial says"it was a mothersday miracle!"and then it all goes red......"the dwelling of dino-riki or pete's dragon",you say?nay,even better- :(i want the number of this tripper's interior decorater! :)well,i am hugely impressed with my first taste of the dvd!(is this thing a registered narcotic?!should be!!!)and i'm guessing just the first part i watched was at least 20 minute to a half hour long!this is the only dvd that even comes close(and skyrockets to new heights!) to giving me the feeling that i had when i first watched the pantera home video part 3!i wanted to cry,run scared,and laugh sadistically the whole time!well,tommarrow is another day-another day to absorb the buckethead show.....quite honestly the greatest show on earth! ???day 3:1990holy cow,i haven't seen short films this intruiging since the early david lynch collection!i loved the video in particular that had bucket emerging from the coop to wreak havoc on a pile of miscelaneous metal shards with a sledge!the one with the trippy music ruled as well,and now i know where that picture of b wearing a turtleneck on the binge n' grab board came from! ;)hey,when the creeps play that show in front of a large brick wall what does bucket grab out of one of the holes near the top of it? :-[gotta say,though,it just keeps getting better by the day(when i can watch it)! :'(day....hmm...too long!93'bob finds our bucket in the closet disobeying direct orders!then when,"the riff"starts,bob yells"rocks in my pants!"but not before scolding bucket;"what you got to say,uh?not alot,not alot!"the songs in the comfort zone of the van fill me with warmth"...all i wanted to do was saw off some loaf...".and,well,big b playing with whom i presume to be john zorn is magnificant,as is his shadow-strumming and SWEET green guitar!94'a total peices airport disaster!when brain says"i hope he can play,he doesn't look so good"that speaks volumes!then this pastrie expert takes change and speaks something of chedder cheese chili croisaunts,later joinging big b in a song presumably called"nobody cares"!huh!then we see mr bucket writhing in the sandbox,playing a rousing game of catch the ball with ol' bobby!joyous times,i'm sure!95'tokyo colma tv spot with dj disk(the "stoner"monotone voice on bucketheadland2?!)followed by an intense performance by the two!(even dj qbert steps in for the show!)96'yet another AMAZING deli creeps gig with all the fantastic gusto they all seem to bring!a very sorrowfull repressed memory,however.97'very cool mask,indeed!while sweepin' fer ma,buck comes across some trippers from another dimension-maskwearers!next thing ya know,you're on the funeral march-holiday style,trying to figure out exactly who the real buckethead is!then the insanity overcomes!first,a mound of flesh with multiple appendages and dorky facial fetures erupts on the screen,followed closely by a live buckethead decapitation!then some locals interveiw the bucketman and inquire about his disneyland obsession.......he loses contol to my amazement and glee!98'there is indeed chicken for all at this show,and bucket is showcasing the album "colma"!I WILL NEVER FORGET ThE PERFORMANCE OF "GHOST"ON HERE!after the show,it's time for staircase shenaningans and then tea and crumpets before shawn lane himself proudly proclaims"save me the slunk!!!!!!"-true highlight btw,bucket's stage energy says it all!99'" "played this live should be illegal!b then has fun with praxis(cut it out and go crazy!),then p-sticks(who i originally thought was rob zombie)showcases the talents of micheal jordan,shawn kemp,and harold miner in dunks that send big b into a rousing rendition of "jump man"!!!keep on bingin'!and we will!00'who WAS that announcer,anyway??!!i though it had to be bernie or georgie at first,but not so!.........buckethead+2 kneck guitar+mikey patton=moonraker!!!deli creeps create more culinary carnage!01'driving,beethoven,wizard of the park,and a bad prom experience sum up this strange,yet hopefully fulfilling year for the buckethead!02'shin terai recording footage that is very cherishable!shin himself must've been so hilarious and cool to work with!AWESOME bruce lee figure display!undercover brother backstage footage has bucket looking very unattatched to his movie surroundings,but once snoop n' bootsy come together for photos b cuts loose!eddie griffin cracks a kfc joke,and the year ends with b playing an entertaining version of the giant robot theme and a giant one being delivered to one special guy's house!guillitane was not the end!!!!!03'how else to end?!parts of a PRO-SHOT deli creeps show with no stingyness on the pinchface expressions!this was def my fav part of the entire dvd-the history of the story and individual!discography:detailed as expected with a few surprises!i wish i could've gotten me a personalized buckethead cd made!demo/unreleased songs:really cool!i loved the "mr sandman"cover in the third or fouth track!gotta love those magazine descriptions of b too!sonic arts lessons:lets just say i'm learning something new every day!toy list:i want the death cube k doll!i might even go so far as to attempt to create on on my own!videos:my second favorite part of the dvd.spokes=insane genius,as does the q-bert,thanatopsis and 6/9 vidz!photoalbum:so many amazing pictures,posters,and drawings-what can a bot say?!the doll itself:an instrument of artistic integrity in all aspects;materials,souls,and deadly weaponry!if yer looking in the mask,get a pole!if you're tempted to take it off,don't!if you hear the voices,he's crying for joy!and everyone gets a helping hand from our man/machine of the hour........BUCKETHEAD!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!disc 2:live footageboth shows show what we all know to be true,and what the new-comers dream of!it just brings the experience totally full-circle!and as the sun comes up on this pleasent june morning i can gladly and firmly attest:this dvd was made for the fans,by a fan,and is presented by truly admirable individuals!"
